title: Beauty Shoot with AI Inspired Makeup
summary: Photographer Lindsay Adler demonstrates a creative workflow using AI art as inspiration for a beauty photoshoot. She breaks down a specific four-light studio setup designed to replicate the hard lighting, saturated colors, and unique aesthetics found in AI-generated reference images.

steps.action: Set up the main light centered on the subject's face to create hard, punchy light that saturates the colors.
Add a second strobe with a tight grid as a fill light centered in front of the subject to lift shadows under the chin without spilling onto the white jacket.
Place a third strobe on a floor stand behind the subject pointing at the background to create a gradient from light grey to black for depth.
Add a fourth strobe overhead as a hair light, using a purple gel to create a colored highlight that matches the makeup palette instead of a white shine.
steps.tool: 1x4' Strip Softbox with Grid + Purple Gel

steps.action: Select camera and lens, utilizing wider focal lengths to mimic the slight distortion often seen in AI art.
steps.tool: Canon EOS R5, Canon RF 24-105mm F/4L

key_takeaways: AI art can serve as a mood board and inspiration for lighting and styling rather than a replacement for photography.
Hard lighting modifiers (like a Magnum reflector) help saturate colors in makeup and body paint.
Using grids on strobes allows for precise control of light spill, essential when filling specific shadow areas without affecting the rest of the image.
Colored gels on hair lights can integrate the subject's hair into the overall color palette of the shoot.
Varying focal lengths and shooting distances can help replicate the unique, sometimes distorted perspective characteristic of AI-generated portraits.
